Record.ClassificationPath: Pathological Conditions, Signs and Symptoms/Pathologic Processes/Hyperbilirubinemia/Hyperbilirubinemia, Neonatal
Congenital, Hereditary, and Neonatal Diseases and Abnormalities/Infant, Newborn, Diseases/Hyperbilirubinemia, Neonatal
Record.BroaderTerm: Congenital, Hereditary, and Neonatal Diseases and Abnormalities
Record.Description: Accumulation of BILIRUBIN, a breakdown product of HEME PROTEINS, in the BLOOD during the first weeks of life. This may lead to NEONATAL JAUNDICE. The excess bilirubin may exist in the unconjugated (indirect) or the conjugated (direct) form. The condition may be self-limiting (PHYSIOLOGICAL NEONATAL JAUNDICE) or pathological with toxic levels of bilirubin.
